QAPair.Question: Do you have information about Implantable cardioverter defibrillator - discharge
QAPair.Answer: An implantable cardioverter-defibrillator (ICD) is a device that detects a life-threatening, abnormal heartbeat. If it occurs, the device sends an electrical shock to the heart to change the rhythm back to normal. This article discusses what you need to know after you have had an ICD inserted. Note: Care of certain special defibrillators may be different than described below.
